<feedback?evolution>
Much block very cheap

Very simple card, very efficient, very powerful. The rate of 12 block for 1 energy is ludicrous. Unless you draw shield of night partway through the turn, it is extremely likely that you won't have ignited the ghostflame yet, and so this is nearly always going to get the refund. Critically, you still get the refund even if you play this as your second skill while on a crushing ghostflame. To be fair, hexaghost already has some excellent mitigation tools available to it, most notably ghost shield, hexaguard, and incorporeal, but this definitely among their ranks, and a card you are usually very happy to see.

It's pretty solid into two of the act 1 elites, though you will need to have enough damage to kill lagavulin before you lose too much strength, and it's pretty bad into nob generally. I actually like it alot for act 1 hallways, since you often can't afford to be spending more than 1 energy blocking, and the efficiency of the card shines there. Really starts to look great in act 2, where the high block value does well against frail, and fights are getting to be more medium length and demand mitigation. Pairs really well with snecko eye, can be used with ghost shield to stockpile large quantities of block. Cheap and effective way to help ignite your crushing ghostflames, but doesn't have a ton of major synergies with hexaghost, largely just really efficient. 

The upgrade is pretty absurd. This isn't really a 2 cost card, so getting a +4 is huge value, making it even more efficient than it already was. You may have other cards (usually powers, or damage cards in the early game) that are higher priorities to upgrade, but this is a great investment as well. Shield of night almost certainly should be nerfed, the numbers just make no sense, and that's largely because it's balanced like it's a 2 cost card, when in reality it basically never is. Either the numbers need to be decreased, or the condition needs to be much harder to meet to warrant them.
hot take but <burning touch> is pretty insane
